name: Park South Hotel

reviews.text: Our room was small, even uncomfortably small. The small size meant that there was little storage space and no spot for a coffee maker or a fridge. As a result, you find yourself tripping over your suitcases a lot and constantly going down to the corner deli for coffee or a cold drink. That being said, the majority of NYC hotel rooms are tiny, and you could pay a lot more without getting that much additional space in return. I think the room size was a fair value.
reviews.title: small room, but good value

reviews.text: Beyond room size, we were very happy with all other aspects of our stay. The staff is very friendly. The hotel is clean. And there’s a large continental breakfast available downstairs everyday at no extra charge.
reviews.title: Tinniest of Rooms
Comfortable hotel, solid location
reviews.text: But the best feature of the hotel is location. A typical NYC tourist might frown on the location because it’s not next to any major attractions. But experienced subway riders will appreciate staying virtually on top of the Lexington line, which allows quick access to Greenwich Village, Chinatown, Little Italy, Grand Central (with a shuttle to Times Square), the Met, and Central Park. St. Patrick’s and Rockefeller Center are also only a few blocks from the Lex line.

reviews.title: Elevator Room
reviews.text: Overall, if you can find a room here for around $200 a night, I would recommend reserving it for your NYC trip.

reviews.title: crazy manager
reviews.text: I booked an overnight stay at the Park South Hotel expedia. I called the hotel directly and confirmed my reservation a few days before my stay on October 24, 2005, and they had my reservation no problem. I checked into the hotel at 4:00 PM, check-in went quick and smooth. Went directly to my room on the 6th floor, opened the door and bumped into the bed. It was by far the smallest room I have stayed in New York City. I did find the room very clean, but if my wife was with me, we would have been bumping into each other. The bathroom was very clean, however, had a smell which seemed to be a seweage type smell, but I could not be certain. The bathroom was so small that I had to shut the door to use the shower. Television was a 19 inch, had HBO, but not movies on demand which I like. Bed clock had a alarm which I used with no problem. A continental breakfast in the hotel restaurant is included in the price of the room, it was simple, but good enough, with bagels, toast, hard boiled eggs, cereal, juice and coffee. Quick and easy. I checked out after breakfast with no trouble. While I found the hotel to be convenienct to my business location, nor did I experience any problems with the hotel, I would not stay there again because for the price I paid I expected a larger room than I received.

reviews.title: Fantastic place to stay
reviews.text: I stayed in Park South with my wife and son during 2nd and 3rd Nov and it was really a fantastic place to stay at. Contrary to the experience of other travellers, we had very fast checkin. In fact the room was registered as we entered the hotel and they also received some messages for us. Probably if you give flght details in advance they do this arrangement. They also upgraded my room to superior double. The room space is very generous for Manhattan and service is excellent. The room was spot lessly clean. We only had the complimentary B/F and it is quite OK. Icing on the ckae was when we ordered for a limo for transfer to La Guardia , we got a Stretch Limo for ordinary limo's price. Though it was emberrassing to get doen at the airport....

We enjoyed the amenities and the food at the Black Duck during our recent stay at Park South. The rooms were cozy and had just enough space, but limited closets and mirrors. Bring some DVDs - our room came with a player. Lots of great restaurants within walking distance. Reasonable parking. Would definitely stay here again and recommend it to friends.
reviews.title: Cute and great location

reviews.text: chose this hotel for my stay last wk based on reviews from this site and was not disappointed
reviews.title: would recommend again

reviews.text: (1) rooms were always cleaned everyday (except one but was remedied immediately upon discussion with the hotel)
reviews.title: Good little hotel
Small but Good
reviews.text: (2) 100 yards away from the subway which was most convenient

We stayed four nights in the Park South in October. We booked on the web and were guided by Trip Advisor. The Hotel was fantastic, we had an excellet room, very good service and ejoyed the facility of the 'Black Duck' restaurant. To our delight there was live Jazz in the bar Friday and Saturday nights. Would definately recommend this hotel as a great place to stay when in New York.
reviews.title: Loved the Park South
Loved it!
reviews.text: I was very pleased with this hotel. The outside leaves a little something to be desired but hey, you are in New York. The neighborhood was exactly what I wanted, it was convenient to everything and the staff was charming. They were kind enough to book reservations at a local mexican place that was delicious. I will stay here again.

reviews.title: stay away at all costs
reviews.text: The rooms are small but this is a boutique hotel in NYC and I've paid more for less in SFO. . .
Certainly worth a try!
reviews.title: A Great Hotel In The Greatest City

reviews.text: Me and my family just got back from a nigt at the Park south Hotel. Let me tell you im not the complaining type, but this hotel deserves all i give it. For one thing there was no door man to help with luggage or open the door.Extremely hard to carry kids and luggage in. Then there is no valet and you have to walk blocks back to the hotel which is not fun when weather is bad. Then I was greeted by the receptionist with a "YES". Not friendly at all. We then proceeded to our room with no offer of help.I was told I had a good room and arrived to a closet size room with prison like decor.A bathroom so small even for one person. The comforter was stained and smelled. A tv that was pathetic in size. I went to the gym they had in basement a 12'x12' closet with 2 out of the 4 pieces of equipment broken. On check out was not asked how my stay was and not thanked for my business. Overall this place is a Hostel with zero class. Ive stayed at 10 to 15 other hotels in the city this was the worst.
reviews.title: Just like the website!

reviews.text: My girlfriend and I stayed at this hotel from Oct 12-16th, 2005 while visiting NYC for theater and fun. We would definitely come back. The location is good with the #6 subway stop near the corner and the theater district just a short cab ride away. Dont miss the good Sushi restaurant, the excellent Italian Wine bar and good jazz at the Jazz Standard, all three are just around the block on 27th. Our room was clean and the staff were very helpful and friendly. Our standard room was small and did not have the view like the deluxe room they show on their website, but hey it's NYC and we were mainly there at night to sleep. We learned the building was only converted to the hotel about 4 years ago so most everything still has a new (and nice) feel. The room was quiet and we did not hear anyone else above or around us. Our toilet did clog one night but they had someone up to snake the drain in 10 minutes. It was a situation easily resolved. The front desk staff and porter staff were friendly and helpful. The continental breakfast is simple but enough to get you out the door to the day's activity where you can think about a nice lunch. For the price ($200 via Price line) I think this was a good deal. We'd definitely go back.
reviews.title: Good Value

reviews.text: Stayed at the Park South Hotel in Mid-September and found this to be good value hotel with a very convenient location.
reviews.title: Solid Hotel and Good Location

reviews.text: The free breakfast was a big bonus and was great quality too. The hotel decor was smart and contemporary and proved a relaxing place to stay for our vacation. Value for money was excellent and I would certainly recommend a stay here. There is an underground station two minutes walk from the hotel which gave great access to the city. There are plenty of bars and restaurants close by and the hotel is close to the Chrysler Building, Empire State, Grand Central and Macys.
reviews.title: A Reasonable Find
Park South - helpful, friendly staff
reviews.text: On the downside, we found housekeeping somewhat lazy and the room was not always as clean as it could have been and storage is very limited. Be prepared to live out of your suitcase if you are here for more than a few days.

reviews.title: A cute boutique
reviews.text: Tip: Book a twin double room as we did for the same price as a standard double, you get much more floorspace in your room.

description: Welcome to the Park SouthA charming boutique hotel in Gramercy ParkIn midtown Manhattan on 28th Street between Park and Lexington avenues is The Park South Hotel, a rare gem among New York City boutique hotels. The beautifully restored 1906 building lies between the stylish Gramercy Park and Murray Hill neighborhoods, drawing discerning corporate and leisure travelers alike.Central location, deluxe accommodations, and consistently excellent service. • Complimentary Deluxe Continental Breakfast• Complimentary WiFi• Complimentary use of the Fitness Center• Iron and Ironing Board• Hairdryer• In-room safe• Bath robe and slippers• 141 guestrooms with king, queen, and 2 double beds • High quality linens on pillow-top beds• Elegant furnishings• Flat screen TVClassic design meets high-tech amenities Photographs of the city from the New York Historical Society archives set the tone. The mezzanine library and European-style lobby evoke a warm, welcoming ambiance rooted in our high quality service—details that keep our guests coming back again and again.Midtown Conference SpaceLet The Park South host your corporate meetings, events, and social functions in our 1,600-plus square feet of meeting space. For sightseeing or business, start hereNavigating New York City couldn’t be easier from our convenient Midtown location. The Six Line subway is steps from our door at Park Avenue and 28th Street. It’s the fastest way to get everywhere in New York – from Central Park and Harlem, to Times Square and the Theatre District, to the Statue of Liberty and Ellis Island ferries.Proud to be a leading Manhattan hotelOur personalized service, comfort, and style match those of celebrated brand names, and our attention to detail ranks favorably with smaller boutiques. Your satisfaction is the number one priority of everyone here, from doorman to executive team.Stay at the Park South Hotel. Make us your home in New York City.
